00020 /**
00021  * Streaming access for fetching segmented CCNx data.
00022  *
00023  * Supports multiple streams from a single connection and
00024  * seeking to an arbitrary position within the associated file.
00025  *
00026  * TBD: need to fix up the case where a segment cannot be fetched but we are
00027  * not really at the end of the stream data.  This case can occur if we express
00028  * an interest for a segment and the interest times out.  Current behavior is
00029  * to treat this as an end-of-stream (prematurely and silently)
00030  *
00031  * TBD: need to provide a more principled (or maybe just controlled) way to
00032  * handle interest timeouts.
00033  */
00034 
00035 #include <ccn/fetch.h>
00036 
00037 #include <sys/types.h>
00038 #include <stdio.h>
00039 #include <stdlib.h>
00040 #include <errno.h>
00041 #include <string.h>
00042 #include <time.h>
00043 #include <unistd.h>
00044 
00045 #include <sys/time.h>
00046 
00047 // TBD: the following constants should be more principled
00048 #define CCN_VERSION_TIMEOUT 8000
00049 #define CCN_INTEREST_TIMEOUT_USECS 15000000
00050 #define MaxSuffixDefault 4
00051 
00052 typedef intmax_t seg_t;
00053 
00054 typedef uint64_t TimeMarker;
00055 
00056 static TimeMarker
00057 GetCurrentTimeUSecs(void) {
00058         const TimeMarker M = 1000*1000;
00059         struct timeval now = {0};
00060     gettimeofday(&now, 0);
00061         return now.tv_sec*M+now.tv_usec;
00062 }
00063 
00064 static intmax_t
00065 DeltaTime(TimeMarker mt1, TimeMarker mt2) {
00066         return(mt2-mt1);
00067 }

00071 struct ccn_fetch {
00072         struct ccn *h;
00073         FILE *debug;
00074         ccn_fetch_flags debugFlags;
00075         int localConnect;
00076         int nStreams;
00077         int maxStreams;
00078         struct ccn_fetch_stream **streams;
00079 };
00080 
00081 struct ccn_fetch_buffer {
00082         struct ccn_fetch_buffer *next;
00083         seg_t seg;                      // the seg for this buffer (< 0 if unassigned)
00084         intmax_t pos;           // the base byte position for this segment
00085         int len;                        // the number of valid bytes
00086         int max;                        // the buffer size
00087         unsigned char *buf;     // where the bytes are
00088 };
00089 
00090 struct localClosure {
00091         struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs;
00092         struct localClosure *next;
00093         seg_t reqSeg;
00094         TimeMarker startClock;
00095 };
00096 
00097 struct ccn_fetch_stream {
00098         struct ccn_fetch *parent;
00099         struct localClosure *requests;  // segment requests in process
00100         int reqBusy;                    // the number of requests busy
00101         int maxBufs;                    // max number of buffers allowed
00102         int nBufs;                              // the number of buffers allocated
00103         struct ccn_fetch_buffer *bufList;       // the buffer list
00104         char *id;
00105         void *context;                  // caller's context
00106         struct ccn_charbuf *name;                       // interest name (without seq#)
00107         struct ccn_charbuf *interest;           // interest template
00108         int segSize;                    // the segment size (-1 if variable, 0 if unknown)
00109         int segsAhead;
00110         intmax_t fileSize;              // the file size (< 0 if unassigned)
00111         intmax_t readPosition;  // the read position (always assigned)
00112         intmax_t readStart;             // the read position at segment start
00113         seg_t readSeg;                  // the segment for the readPosition
00114         seg_t timeoutSeg;               // the lowest timeout segment seen
00115         seg_t zeroLenSeg;               // the lowest zero len segment seen
00116         seg_t finalSeg;                 // final segment number (< 0 if not known yet)
00117         int finalSegLen;                // final segment length
00118         intmax_t timeoutUSecs;  // microseconds for interest timeout
00119         intmax_t timeoutsSeen;
00120         seg_t segsRead;
00121         seg_t segsRequested;
00122 };
00123 
00124 // forward reference
00125 static enum ccn_upcall_res
00126 CallMe(struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00127            enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00128            struct ccn_upcall_info *info);

00134 static char *globalNullString = "";
00135 static char *
00136 newStringCopy(const char *src) {
00137         int n = ((src == NULL) ? 0 : strlen(src));
00138         if (n <= 0 || src == globalNullString) return globalNullString;
00139         char *s = calloc(n+1, sizeof(*s));
00140         strncpy(s, src, n);
00141         return s;
00142 }
00143 
00144 static char *
00145 freeString(char * s) {
00146         if (s != NULL && s != globalNullString)
00147                 free(s);
00148         return NULL;
00149 }
00150 
00151 static struct ccn_charbuf *
00152 sequenced_name(struct ccn_charbuf *basename, seg_t seq) {
00153     // creates a new struct ccn_charbuf *, appending the sequence number to the basename
00154         struct ccn_charbuf *name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00155     ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(name, basename);
00156         if (seq >= 0)
00157                 ccn_name_append_numeric(name, CCN_MARKER_SEQNUM, seq);
00158     return(name);
00159 }
00160 
00161 static struct ccn_charbuf *
00162 make_data_template(int maxSuffix) {
00163         // creates a template for interests that only have a name
00164         // and a segment number
00165         struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00166     ccnb_element_begin(cb, CCN_DTAG_Interest);
00167     ccnb_element_begin(cb, CCN_DTAG_Name);
00168     ccnb_element_end(cb); /* </Name> */
00169     ccnb_element_begin(cb, CCN_DTAG_MaxSuffixComponents);
00170     ccnb_append_number(cb, maxSuffix);
00171     ccnb_element_end(cb); /* </MaxSuffixComponents> */
00172     ccnb_element_end(cb); /* </Interest> */
00173     return(cb);
00174 }
00175 
00176 static seg_t
00177 GetNumberFromInfo(const unsigned char *ccnb,
00178                                   enum ccn_dtag tt, size_t start, size_t stop) {
00179         // gets the binary number for the info
00180         // based on the tag and the start and stop indexes
00181         // returns -1 if the number does not appear to exist
00182         // must be called from inside of CallMe
00183         if (start < stop) {
00184                 size_t len = 0;
00185                 const unsigned char *data = NULL;
00186                 ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(tt, ccnb, start, stop, &data, &len);
00187                 if (len > 0 && data != NULL) {
00188                         // parse big-endian encoded number
00189                         seg_t n = 0;
00190                         size_t i;
00191             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
00192                                 n = n * 256 + data[i];
00193                         }
00194                         return n;
00195                 }
00196         }
00197         return -1;
00198 }
00199 
00200 static seg_t
00201 GetFinalSegment(struct ccn_upcall_info *info) {
00202         // gets the final segment number for the content
00203         // returns -1 if it is not yet known
00204         // must be called from inside of CallMe
00205         if (info == NULL) return -1;
00206         const unsigned char *ccnb = info->content_ccnb;
00207         if (ccnb == NULL || info->pco == NULL) return -1;
00208         int start = info->pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_FinalBlockID];
00209         int stop = info->pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E_FinalBlockID];
00210         return GetNumberFromInfo(ccnb, CCN_DTAG_FinalBlockID, start, stop);
00211 }
00212 
00213 static struct localClosure *
00214 AddSegRequest(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs, seg_t seg) {
00215         // adds a segment request, returns NULL if already present
00216         // or if the seg given is outside the valid range
00217         // returns the new request if it was created
00218         FILE *debug = fs->parent->debug;
00219         ccn_fetch_flags flags = fs->parent->debugFlags;
00220         if (seg < 0) return NULL;
00221         if (fs->finalSeg >= 0 && seg > fs->finalSeg) return NULL;
00222         struct localClosure *req = fs->requests;
00223         while (req != NULL) {
00224                 if (req->reqSeg == seg) return NULL;
00225                 req = req->next;
00226         }
00227         req = calloc(1, sizeof(*req));
00228         req->fs = fs;
00229         req->reqSeg = seg;
00230         req->startClock = GetCurrentTimeUSecs();
00231         req->next = fs->requests;
00232         fs->requests = req;
00233         if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteAddRem)) {
00234                 fprintf(debug, "-- ccn_fetch AddSegRequest %s, seg %jd\n",
00235                                 fs->id, seg);
00236                 fflush(debug);
00237         }
00238         return req;
00239 }
00240 
00241 static struct localClosure *
00242 RemSegRequest(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs, struct localClosure *req) {
00243         // removes a segment request
00244         // returns NULL if the request was removed
00245         // if not found then just returns the request
00246         FILE *debug = fs->parent->debug;
00247         ccn_fetch_flags flags = fs->parent->debugFlags;
00248         struct localClosure *this = fs->requests;
00249         struct localClosure *lag = NULL;
00250         seg_t seg = req->reqSeg;
00251         while (this != NULL) {
00252                 struct localClosure *next = this->next;
00253                 if (this == req) {
00254                         if (lag == NULL) {
00255                                 fs->requests = next;
00256                         } else {
00257                                 lag->next = next;
00258                         }
00259                         req->fs = NULL;
00260                         if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteAddRem)) {
00261                                 fprintf(debug, "-- ccn_fetch RemSegRequest %s, seg %jd\n",
00262                                                 fs->id, seg);
00263                                 fflush(debug);
00264                         }
00265                         return NULL;
00266                 }
00267                 lag = this;
00268                 this = next;
00269         }
00270         if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteAddRem)) {
00271                 fprintf(debug, "-- ccn_fetch RemSegRequest %s, seg %jd, NOT FOUND!\n",
00272                                 fs->id, seg);
00273                 fflush(debug);
00274         }
00275         return req;
00276 }
00277 
00278 static struct ccn_fetch_buffer *
00279 FindBufferForSeg(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs, seg_t seg) {
00280         // finds the buffer object given the seg
00281         struct ccn_fetch_buffer *fb = fs->bufList;
00282         for (;;) {
00283                 if (fb == NULL) break;
00284                 if (fb->seg == seg) break;
00285                 fb = fb->next;
00286         } 
00287         return fb;
00288 }
00289 
00290 static struct ccn_fetch_buffer *
00291 FindBufferForPosition(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs, intmax_t pos) {
00292         // finds the buffer object given the seg
00293         struct ccn_fetch_buffer *fb = fs->bufList;
00294         for (;;) {
00295                 if (fb == NULL) break;
00296                 intmax_t fp = fb->pos;
00297                 if (fp >= 0 && pos >= fp && pos < fp+fb->len) break;
00298                 fb = fb->next;
00299         } 
00300         return fb;
00301 }
00302 
00303 static intmax_t
00304 InferPosition(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs, seg_t seg) {
00305         intmax_t pos = -1; // by default, size is unknown
00306         if (seg == 0) {
00307                 // initial seg is easy, size regardless
00308                 pos = 0;
00309         } else if (fs->segSize > 0) {
00310                 // fixed size is almost as easy
00311                 pos = seg*fs->segSize;
00312         } else if (seg == fs->readSeg) {
00313                 // position is based on the current read position 
00314                 pos = fs->readStart;
00315         } else {
00316                 // try to get the position from the previous buffer
00317                 struct ccn_fetch_buffer *ofb = FindBufferForSeg(fs, seg-1);
00318                 if (ofb != NULL && ofb->pos >= 0)
00319                         pos = ofb->pos+ofb->len;
00320         }
00321         return pos;
00322 }
00323 
00324 static struct ccn_fetch_buffer *
00325 NewBufferForSeg(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs, seg_t seg, size_t len) {
00326         // makes a new buffer for the segment
00327         struct ccn_fetch_buffer *fb = calloc(1, sizeof(*fb));
00328         if (len > 0) fb->buf = calloc(len, sizeof(unsigned char));
00329         fb->seg = seg;
00330         intmax_t pos = InferPosition(fs, seg);
00331         fb->pos = pos;
00332         fb->len = len;
00333         fs->nBufs++;
00334         fb->next = fs->bufList;
00335         fs->bufList = fb;
00336         fs->segsAhead++;
00337         if (fs->segsAhead >= fs->maxBufs) fs->segsAhead = fs->maxBufs-1;
00338         if (fs->segSize <= 0 && pos >= 0) {
00339                 // segment size is variable or unknown
00340                 // position for buffer is known, so propagate forwards
00341                 for (;;) {
00342                         if (fs->fileSize < 0) {
00343                                 // maybe we just found the file size
00344                                 if (seg == fs->finalSeg
00345                                         || (seg+1 == fs->finalSeg && fs->finalSegLen == 0))
00346                                         fs->fileSize = pos+len;
00347                         }
00348                         seg++;
00349                         struct ccn_fetch_buffer *ofb = FindBufferForSeg(fs, seg);
00350                         if (ofb == NULL || ofb->pos >= 0) break;
00351                         pos = pos + len;
00352                         ofb->pos = pos;
00353                         len = ofb->len;
00354                 }
00355         }
00356         return fb;
00357 }
00358 
00359 static void
00360 PruneSegments(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs) {
00361         intmax_t start = fs->readStart;
00362         struct ccn_fetch_buffer *lag = NULL;
00363         struct ccn_fetch_buffer *fb = fs->bufList;
00364         while (fb != NULL && fs->nBufs > fs->maxBufs) {
00365                 struct ccn_fetch_buffer *next = fb->next;
00366                 if (fs->maxBufs == 0 || (fb->pos >= 0 && start > (fb->pos + fb->len))) {
00367                         // this buffer is going away
00368                         // note: keep buffer immediately before readStart if possible
00369                         if (lag == NULL) {
00370                                 fs->bufList = next;
00371                         } else {
00372                                 lag->next = next;
00373                         }
00374                         if (fb->buf != NULL) free(fb->buf);
00375                         free(fb);
00376                         fs->nBufs--;
00377                 } else {
00378                         // keep this buffer in play
00379                         lag = fb;
00380                 }
00381                 fb = next;
00382         }
00383 }
00384 
00385 static void
00386 NeedSegment(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs, seg_t seg) {
00387         // requests that a specific segment interest be registered
00388         // but ONLY if it the request not already in flight
00389         // AND the segment is not already in a buffer
00390         struct ccn_fetch_buffer *fb = FindBufferForSeg(fs, seg);
00391         if (fb != NULL)
00392                 // no point in requesting what we have
00393                 return;
00394         if (fs->finalSeg >= 0 && seg > fs->finalSeg)
00395                 // no point in requesting off the end, either
00396                 return;
00397         if (fs->timeoutSeg > 0 && seg >= fs->timeoutSeg)
00398                 // don't request a timed-out segment
00399                 return;
00400         if (fs->zeroLenSeg > 0 && seg >= fs->zeroLenSeg)
00401                 // don't request a zero-length segment
00402                 return;
00403         struct localClosure *req = AddSegRequest(fs, seg);
00404         if (req != NULL) {
00405                 FILE *debug = fs->parent->debug;
00406                 ccn_fetch_flags flags = fs->parent->debugFlags;
00407                 struct ccn_charbuf *temp = sequenced_name(fs->name, seg);
00408                 struct ccn *h = fs->parent->h;
00409                 struct ccn_closure *action = calloc(1, sizeof(*action));
00410                 action->data = req;
00411                 action->p = &CallMe;
00412                 int res = ccn_express_interest(h, temp, action, fs->interest);
00413                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&temp);
00414                 if (res >= 0) {
00415                         // the ccn connection accepted our request
00416                         fs->reqBusy++;
00417                         fs->segsRequested++;
00418                         if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteNeed)) {
00419                                 fprintf(debug,
00420                                                 "-- ccn_fetch NeedSegment %s, seg %jd",
00421                                                 fs->id, seg);
00422                                 if (fs->finalSeg >= 0)
00423                                         fprintf(debug, ", final %jd", fs->finalSeg);
00424                                 fprintf(debug, "\n");
00425                                 fflush(debug);
00426                         }
00427                         return;
00428                 }
00429                 // the request was not placed, so get rid of the evidence
00430                 // CallMe won't get a chance to free it
00431                 if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteNeed)) {
00432                         fprintf(debug,
00433                                         "** ccn_fetch NeedSegment failed, %s, seg %jd\n",
00434                                         fs->id, seg);
00435                         fflush(debug);
00436                 }
00437                 RemSegRequest(fs, req);
00438                 free(req);
00439                 free(action);
00440         
00441         }
00442 }
00443 
00444 static void
00445 NeedSegments(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs) {
00446         // determines which segments should be requested
00447         // based on the current readSeg and maxBufs 
00448         seg_t loSeg = fs->readSeg;
00449         seg_t hiSeg = loSeg+fs->segsAhead;
00450         seg_t finalSeg = fs->finalSeg;
00451         if (finalSeg >= 0 && hiSeg > finalSeg) hiSeg = finalSeg;
00452         if (loSeg > hiSeg) hiSeg = loSeg;
00453         while (loSeg <= hiSeg) {
00454                 // try to request needed segments
00455                 NeedSegment(fs, loSeg);
00456                 loSeg++;
00457         }
00458 }
00459 
00460 static void
00461 ShowDelta(FILE *f, TimeMarker from) {
00462         intmax_t dt = DeltaTime(from, GetCurrentTimeUSecs());
00463         fprintf(f, ", dt %jd.%06d\n", dt / 1000000, (int) (dt % 1000000));
00464         fflush(f);
00465 }
00466 
00467 static enum ccn_upcall_res
00468 CallMe(struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00469            enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00470            struct ccn_upcall_info *info) {
00471         // CallMe is the callback routine invoked by ccn_run when a registered
00472         // interest has something interesting happen.
00473     struct localClosure *req = (struct localClosure *)selfp->data;
00474         seg_t thisSeg = req->reqSeg;
00475     struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs = (struct ccn_fetch_stream *) req->fs;
00476         if (fs == NULL) {
00477                 if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_FINAL) {
00478                         // orphaned, so just get rid of it
00479                         free(req);
00480                         free(selfp);
00481                 }
00482                 return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00483         }
00484         FILE *debug = fs->parent->debug;
00485         seg_t finalSeg = fs->finalSeg;
00486         ccn_fetch_flags flags = fs->parent->debugFlags;
00487         if (finalSeg < 0) {
00488                 // worth a try to find the last segment
00489                 finalSeg = GetFinalSegment(info);
00490                 fs->finalSeg = finalSeg;
00491         }
00492     
00493         switch (kind) {
00494                 case CCN_UPCALL_FINAL:
00495                         // this is the cleanup for an expressed interest
00496                         req = RemSegRequest(fs, req);
00497                         if (fs->reqBusy > 0) fs->reqBusy--;
00498                         free(selfp);
00499                         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00500                 case CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST_TIMED_OUT: {
00501                         if (finalSeg >= 0 && thisSeg > finalSeg)
00502                                 // ignore this timeout quickly
00503                                 return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00504                         intmax_t dt = DeltaTime(req->startClock, GetCurrentTimeUSecs());
00505                         if (dt >= fs->timeoutUSecs) {
00506                                 // timed out, too many retries
00507                                 // assume that this interest will never produce
00508                                 seg_t timeoutSeg = fs->timeoutSeg;
00509                                 fs->timeoutsSeen++;
00510                                 fs->segsAhead = 0;
00511                                 if (timeoutSeg < 0 || thisSeg < timeoutSeg) {
00512                                         // we can infer a new timeoutSeg
00513                                         fs->timeoutSeg = thisSeg;
00514                                 }
00515                                 if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteTimeout)) {
00516                                         fprintf(debug, 
00517                                                         "** ccn_fetch timeout, %s, seg %jd",
00518                                                         fs->id, thisSeg);
00519                                         fprintf(debug, 
00520                                                         ", dt %jd us, timeoutUSecs %jd\n",
00521                                                         dt, fs->timeoutUSecs);
00522                                         fflush(debug);
00523                                 }
00524                                 return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00525                         }
00526                         // TBD: may need to reseed bloom filter?  who to ask?
00527                         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_REEXPRESS);
00528                 }
00529                 case CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_UNVERIFIED:
00530                         return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_VERIFY);
00531                 case CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_KEYMISSING:
00532                         return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_FETCHKEY);
00533                 case CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT:
00534                 case CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_RAW:
00535                         if (fs->timeoutSeg >= 0 && fs->timeoutSeg <= thisSeg)
00536                                 // we will ignore this, since we are blocked
00537                                 return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00538                         break;
00539                 default:
00540                         // SHOULD NOT HAPPEN
00541                         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
00542     }
00543         
00544         struct ccn_fetch_buffer *fb = FindBufferForSeg(fs, thisSeg);
00545         if (fb == NULL) {
00546                 // we don't already have the data yet
00547                 const unsigned char *data = NULL;
00548                 size_t dataLen = 0;
00549                 size_t ccnb_size = info->pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E];
00550                 const unsigned char *ccnb = info->content_ccnb;
00551                 int res = ccn_content_get_value(ccnb, ccnb_size, info->pco,
00552                                                                                 &data, &dataLen);
00553                 
00554                 if (res < 0 || (thisSeg != finalSeg && dataLen == 0)) {
00555                         // we got a bogus result, no data in this content!
00556                         if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteAddRem)) {
00557                                 fprintf(debug, 
00558                                                 "-- ccn_fetch no data, %s, seg %jd, final %jd",
00559                                                 fs->id, thisSeg, finalSeg);
00560                                 ShowDelta(debug, req->startClock);
00561                         }
00562                         if (fs->zeroLenSeg < 0 || thisSeg < fs->zeroLenSeg)
00563                                 // note this problem for future reporting
00564                                 fs->zeroLenSeg = thisSeg;
00565                 } else if (thisSeg == finalSeg && dataLen == 0) {
00566                         // EOF, but no buffer needed
00567                         if (fs->fileSize < 0)
00568                                 fs->fileSize = InferPosition(fs, thisSeg);
00569                         fs->finalSeg = finalSeg-1;
00570                         if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteFinal)) {
00571                                 fprintf(debug, 
00572                                                 "-- ccn_fetch EOF, %s, seg %jd, len %d, fs %jd",
00573                                                 fs->id, thisSeg,
00574                                                 (int) dataLen,
00575                                                 fs->fileSize);
00576                                 ShowDelta(debug, req->startClock);
00577                         }
00578                         
00579                 } else {
00580                         // alloc a buffer and transfer the data
00581                         
00582                         if (fs->segSize == 0) {
00583                                 // assuming fixed size segments, so any should do
00584                                 // EXCEPT for an incomplete final segment
00585                                 if (thisSeg == 0 || thisSeg < finalSeg)
00586                                         fs->segSize = dataLen;
00587                         }
00588                         if (thisSeg == finalSeg) fs->finalSegLen = dataLen;
00589                         struct ccn_fetch_buffer *fb = NewBufferForSeg(fs, thisSeg, dataLen);
00590                         memcpy(fb->buf, data, dataLen);
00591                         if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteFill)) {
00592                                 fprintf(debug, 
00593                                                 "-- ccn_fetch FillSeg, %s, seg %jd, len %d, nbuf %d",
00594                                                 fs->id, thisSeg, (int) dataLen, (int) fs->nBufs);
00595                                 ShowDelta(debug, req->startClock);
00596                         }
00597                         if (thisSeg == finalSeg) {
00598                                 // the file size is known in segments
00599                                 if (fs->segSize <= 0) {
00600                                         // variable or unknown segment size
00601                                         if (fb->pos >= 0) {
00602                                                 fs->fileSize = fb->pos + dataLen;
00603                                         }
00604                                 } else {
00605                                         // fixed segment size, so file size is now known
00606                                         fs->fileSize = thisSeg * fs->segSize + dataLen;
00607                                 }
00608                                 if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteFinal)) {
00609                                         fprintf(debug, 
00610                                                         "-- ccn_fetch EOF, %s, seg %jd, len %d, fs %jd",
00611                                                         fs->id, thisSeg, (int) dataLen, fs->fileSize);
00612                                         ShowDelta(debug, req->startClock);
00613                                 }
00614                         }
00615                         fs->segsRead++;
00616                 }
00617         }
00618         
00619         ccn_set_run_timeout(fs->parent->h, 0);
00620         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00621 }
00622 
00623 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00624 // External routines
00625 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00626 
00627 /**
00628  * Creates a new ccn_fetch object using the given ccn connection.
00629  * If h == NULL, attempts to create a new connection automatically.
00630  * @returns NULL if the creation was not successful
00631  * (only can happen for the h == NULL case).
00632  */
00633 extern struct ccn_fetch *
00634 ccn_fetch_new(struct ccn *h) {
00635         struct ccn_fetch *f = calloc(1, sizeof(*f));
00636         if (h == NULL) {
00637                 h = ccn_create();
00638                 int connRes = ccn_connect(h, NULL);
00639                 if (connRes < 0) {
00640                         ccn_destroy(&h);
00641                         free(f);
00642                         return NULL;
00643                 }
00644                 f->localConnect = 1;
00645         }
00646         f->h = h;
00647         return f;
00648 }
00649 
00650 void
00651 ccn_fetch_set_debug(struct ccn_fetch *f, FILE *debug, ccn_fetch_flags flags) {
00652         f->debug = debug;
00653         f->debugFlags = flags;
00654 }
00655 
00656 /**
00657  * Destroys a ccn_fetch object.
00658  * Only destroys the underlying ccn connection if it was automatically created.
00659  * Forces all underlying streams to close immediately.
00660  * @returns NULL in all cases.
00661  */
00662 extern struct ccn_fetch *
00663 ccn_fetch_destroy(struct ccn_fetch *f) {
00664         // destroys a ccn_fetch object
00665         // always returns NULL
00666         // only destroys the underlying ccn connection if it was
00667         // automatically created, otherwise does not alter it
00668         if (f != NULL) {
00669                 struct ccn *h = f->h;
00670                 if (h != NULL && f->localConnect) {
00671                         ccn_disconnect(h);
00672                         ccn_destroy(&f->h);
00673                 }
00674                 // take down all of the streams
00675                 while (f->nStreams > 0) {
00676                         struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs = f->streams[0];
00677                         if (fs == NULL) break;
00678                         ccn_fetch_close(fs);
00679                 }
00680                 free(f);
00681         }
00682         return NULL;
00683 }
00684 
00685 /**
00686  * Polls the underlying streams and attempts to make progress.
00687  * Scans the streams for those that have data already present, or are at the end
00688  * of the stream.  If the count is 0, perfoms a ccn_poll on the underlying
00689  * ccn connection with a 0 timeout.
00690  *
00691  * NOTE: periodic calls to ccn_fetch_poll should be performed to update
00692  * the contents of the streams UNLESS the client is calling ccn_run for
00693  * the underlying ccn connection.
00694  * @returns the count of streams that have pending data or have ended.
00695  */
00696 extern int
00697 ccn_fetch_poll(struct ccn_fetch *f) {
00698         int i;
00699     int count = 0;
00700         int ns = f->nStreams;
00701         for (i = 0; i < ns; i++) {
00702                 struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs = f->streams[i];
00703                 if (fs != NULL) {
00704                         intmax_t avail = ccn_fetch_avail(fs);
00705                         if (avail >= 0) count++;
00706                 }
00707         }
00708         // we should try for more progress
00709         ccn_run(f->h, 0);
00710         return count;
00711 }
00712 
00713 /**
00714  * Provides an iterator through the underlying streams.
00715  * Use fs == NULL to start the iteration, and an existing stream to continue
00716  * the iteration.
00717  * @returns the next stream in the iteration, or NULL at the end.
00718  * Note that providing a stale (closed) stream handle will return NULL.
00719  */
00720 extern struct ccn_fetch_stream *
00721 ccn_fetch_next(struct ccn_fetch *f, struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs) {
00722         int i;
00723     int ns = f->nStreams;
00724     struct ccn_fetch_stream *lag = NULL;
00725         for (i = 0; i < ns; i++) {
00726                 struct ccn_fetch_stream *tfs = f->streams[i];
00727                 if (tfs != NULL) {
00728                         if (lag == fs) return tfs;
00729                         lag = tfs;
00730                 }
00731         }
00732         return NULL;
00733 }
00734 
00735 /**
00736  * Sets caller's context for the stream.
00737  */
00738 void 
00739 ccn_fetch_set_context(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs, void *context)
00740 {
00741         fs->context = context;
00742 }
00743 
00744 /**
00745  * @returns caller's context, as previously set for the stream.
00746  */
00747 void *
00748 ccn_fetch_get_context(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs)
00749 {
00750         return fs->context;
00751 }
00752 
00753 /**
00754  * @returns the underlying ccn connection.
00755  */
00756 extern struct ccn *
00757 ccn_fetch_get_ccn(struct ccn_fetch *f) {
00758         return f->h;
00759 }
00760 
00761 /**
00762  * Creates a stream for a named interest.
00763  * The name should be a ccnb encoded interest.
00764  * If resolveVersion, then we assume that the version is unresolved, 
00765  * and an attempt is made to determine the version number using the highest
00766  * version.
00767  * The number of buffers (nBufs) may be silently limited.
00768  * @returns NULL if the stream creation failed,
00769  * otherwise returns the new stream.
00770  */
00771 extern struct ccn_fetch_stream *
00772 ccn_fetch_open(struct ccn_fetch *f,
00773                            struct ccn_charbuf *name,
00774                            const char *id,
00775                            struct ccn_charbuf *interestTemplate,
00776                            int maxBufs,
00777                            int resolveVersion,
00778                            int assumeFixed) {
00779         // returns a new ccn_fetch_stream object based on the arguments
00780         // returns NULL if not successful
00781     if (maxBufs <= 0) return NULL;
00782         if (maxBufs > 16) maxBufs = 16;
00783         int res = 0;
00784         FILE *debug = f->debug;
00785         ccn_fetch_flags flags = f->debugFlags;
00786     
00787         // first, resolve the version
00788         struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs = calloc(1, sizeof(*fs));
00789         fs->segSize = (assumeFixed ? 0 : -1);
00790         fs->name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00791         fs->id = newStringCopy(id);
00792         ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(fs->name, name);
00793         if (resolveVersion) {
00794         res = ccn_resolve_version(f->h, fs->name, resolveVersion, CCN_VERSION_TIMEOUT);
00795                 if (res < 0) {
00796                         // could not resolve version for this name
00797                         // get rid of allocations so far and bail out
00798                         if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteOpenClose)) {
00799                                 fprintf(debug, 
00800                                                 "-- ccn_fetch open, %s, failed to resolve version\n",
00801                                                 fs->id);
00802                                 fflush(debug);
00803                         }
00804                         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&fs->name);
00805                         freeString(fs->id);
00806                         free(fs);
00807                         return NULL;
00808                 }
00809         }
00810         fs->maxBufs = maxBufs;
00811         fs->segsAhead = 0;
00812         fs->fileSize = -1;
00813         fs->finalSeg = -1;
00814         fs->timeoutSeg = -1;
00815         fs->zeroLenSeg = -1;
00816         fs->parent = f;
00817         fs->timeoutUSecs = CCN_INTEREST_TIMEOUT_USECS;  // TBD: how to get better timeout?
00818         
00819         // use the supplied template or the default
00820         if (interestTemplate != NULL) {
00821                 struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00822                 ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(cb, interestTemplate);
00823                 fs->interest = cb;
00824         } else
00825                 fs->interest = make_data_template(MaxSuffixDefault);
00826         
00827         
00828         // remember the stream in the parent
00829         int ns = f->nStreams;
00830         int max = f->maxStreams;
00831         if (ns >= max) {
00832                 // extend the vector
00833                 int nMax = max+max/2+4;
00834         struct ccn_fetch_stream **streams;
00835         streams = realloc(f->streams, sizeof(*(f->streams)) * nMax);
00836         if (streams == NULL) {
00837             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&fs->name);
00838             freeString(fs->id);
00839             free(fs);            
00840             return (NULL); // TBD: should this be handled differently?
00841         }
00842         f->streams = streams;
00843                 f->maxStreams = nMax;
00844         }
00845         // guaranteed room to add at the end
00846         f->streams[ns] = fs;
00847         f->nStreams = ns+1;
00848         
00849         if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteOpenClose)) {
00850                 fprintf(debug, 
00851                                 "-- ccn_fetch open, %s\n",
00852                                 fs->id);
00853                 fflush(debug);
00854         }
00855         // prep for the first segment
00856         NeedSegment(fs, 0);
00857         return fs;
00858 }
00859 
00860 /**
00861  * Closes the stream and reclaims any resources used by the stream.
00862  * The stream object will be freed, so the client must not access it again.
00863  * @returns NULL in all cases.
00864  */
00865 extern struct ccn_fetch_stream *
00866 ccn_fetch_close(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs) {
00867         // destroys a ccn_fetch_stream object
00868         // implicit abort of any outstanding fetches
00869         // always returns NULL
00870         int i;
00871     FILE *debug = fs->parent->debug;
00872         ccn_fetch_flags flags = fs->parent->debugFlags;
00873     
00874         // make orphans of all outstanding requests
00875         // CallMe should handle the cleanup
00876         struct localClosure * this = fs->requests;
00877         fs->requests = NULL;
00878         while (this != NULL) {
00879                 this->fs = NULL;
00880                 this = this->next;
00881         }
00882         // free up the buffers
00883         fs->maxBufs = 0;
00884         PruneSegments(fs);
00885         
00886         if (fs->name != NULL)
00887                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&fs->name);
00888         if (fs->interest != NULL)
00889                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&fs->interest);
00890         struct ccn_fetch *f = fs->parent;
00891         if (f != NULL) {
00892                 int ns = f->nStreams;
00893                 fs->parent = NULL;
00894                 for (i = 0; i < ns; i++) {
00895                         struct ccn_fetch_stream *tfs = f->streams[i];
00896                         if (tfs == fs) {
00897                                 // found it, so get rid of it
00898                                 ns--;
00899                                 f->nStreams = ns;
00900                                 f->streams[i] = NULL;
00901                                 f->streams[i] = f->streams[ns];
00902                                 f->streams[ns] = NULL;  
00903                                 break;  
00904                         }
00905                 }
00906         }
00907         if (debug != NULL && (flags & ccn_fetch_flags_NoteOpenClose)) {
00908                 fprintf(debug, 
00909                                 "-- ccn_fetch close, %s, segReq %jd, segsRead %jd, timeouts %jd\n",
00910                                 fs->id,
00911                                 fs->segsRequested,
00912                                 fs->segsRead,
00913                                 fs->timeoutsSeen);
00914                 fflush(debug);
00915         }
00916         // finally, get rid of the stream object
00917         freeString(fs->id);
00918         free(fs);
00919         return NULL;
00920 }
00921 
00922 /**
00923  * Tests for available bytes in the stream.
00924  */
00925 extern intmax_t
00926 ccn_fetch_avail(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs) {
00927         intmax_t pos = fs->readPosition;
00928         if (fs->fileSize >= 0 && pos >= fs->fileSize) {
00929                 // file size known, and we are at the limit
00930                 return CCN_FETCH_READ_END;
00931         }
00932         intmax_t avail = 0;
00933         seg_t seg = fs->readSeg;
00934         if (fs->timeoutSeg >= 0 && seg >= fs->timeoutSeg)
00935                 // timeout indication
00936                 return CCN_FETCH_READ_TIMEOUT;
00937         if (fs->zeroLenSeg >= 0 && seg >= fs->zeroLenSeg)
00938                 // zero len indication
00939                 return CCN_FETCH_READ_ZERO;
00940         seg_t finalSeg = fs->finalSeg;
00941         if (seg > finalSeg && fs->finalSeg >= 0)
00942                 // seek beyond EOF may cause this
00943                 return CCN_FETCH_READ_NONE;
00944         
00945         for (;;) {
00946                 struct ccn_fetch_buffer *fb = FindBufferForSeg(fs, seg);
00947                 if (fb == NULL) break;
00948                 if (fb->pos < 0) fb->pos = pos;
00949                 int len = fb->len;
00950                 if (seg == fs->readSeg) {
00951                         // adjust for offset into the buffer
00952                         intmax_t off = pos - fb->pos;
00953                         if (off > 0) len = len - off;
00954                 }
00955                 avail = avail + len;
00956                 pos = pos + len;
00957                 seg++;
00958         }
00959         if (avail == 0)
00960                 // nothing available at this time, but not at the end, we think
00961                 return CCN_FETCH_READ_NONE;
00962         return avail;
00963 }
00964 
00965 /**
00966  * Reads bytes from a stream.
00967  * Reads at most len bytes into buf from the given stream.
00968  * Will not wait for bytes to arrive.
00969  * Advances the read position on a successful read.
00970  * @returns
00971  *    CCN_FETCH_READ_TIMEOUT if a timeout occurred,
00972  *    CCN_FETCH_READ_ZERO if a zero-length segment was found
00973  *    CCN_FETCH_READ_NONE if no bytes are immediately available
00974  *    CCN_FETCH_READ_END if the stream is at the end,
00975  *    and N > 0 if N bytes were read.
00976  */
00977 extern intmax_t
00978 ccn_fetch_read(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs,
00979                            void *buf,
00980                            intmax_t len) {
00981         if (len < 0 || buf == NULL) {
00982                 return CCN_FETCH_READ_NONE;
00983         }
00984         intmax_t off = 0;
00985         intmax_t pos = fs->readPosition;
00986         if (fs->fileSize >= 0 && pos >= fs->fileSize) {
00987                 // file size known, and we are at the limit
00988                 return CCN_FETCH_READ_END;
00989         }
00990         intmax_t nr = 0;
00991         unsigned char *dst = (unsigned char *) buf;
00992         seg_t seg = fs->readSeg;
00993         
00994         if (fs->timeoutSeg >= 0 && seg >= fs->timeoutSeg)
00995                 // if a needed read timed out, then we say so
00996                 return CCN_FETCH_READ_TIMEOUT;
00997         if (fs->zeroLenSeg >= 0 && seg >= fs->zeroLenSeg)
00998                 // if we got a zero length segment, report it
00999                 return CCN_FETCH_READ_ZERO;
01000         while (len > 0) {
01001                 struct ccn_fetch_buffer *fb = FindBufferForSeg(fs, seg);
01002                 if (fb == NULL) break;
01003                 unsigned char *src = fb->buf;
01004                 intmax_t start = fb->pos;
01005                 intmax_t lo = start;
01006                 if (lo < 0) {
01007                         // segments delivered at random might cause this
01008                         lo = pos;
01009                         fb->pos = pos;
01010                 }
01011                 intmax_t hi = lo + fb->len;
01012                 if (pos < lo || pos >= hi || seg != fb->seg) {
01013                         // this SHOULD NOT HAPPEN!
01014                         FILE *debug = fs->parent->debug;
01015                         if (debug != NULL) {
01016                                 fprintf(debug, 
01017                                                 "** ccn_fetch read, %s, seg %jd, pos %jd, lo %jd, hi %jd\n",
01018                                                 fs->id, seg, pos, (intmax_t) lo, (intmax_t) hi);
01019                                 fflush(debug);
01020                         }
01021                         break;
01022                 }
01023                 intmax_t d = hi - pos;
01024                 if (d > len) d = len;
01025                 memcpy(dst+off, src+(pos-lo), d);
01026                 nr = nr + d;
01027                 pos = pos + d;
01028                 off = off + d;
01029                 len = len - d;
01030                 fs->readPosition = pos;
01031                 fs->readStart = start;
01032                 if (pos == hi) {
01033                         // finished the bytes in this segment
01034                         seg++;
01035                         fs->readSeg = seg;
01036                         fs->readStart = pos;
01037                 }
01038         }
01039         NeedSegments(fs);
01040         PruneSegments(fs);
01041         if (nr == 0) {
01042                 return CCN_FETCH_READ_NONE;
01043         }
01044         return nr;
01045 }
01046 
01047 /**
01048  * Resets the timeout marker.
01049  */
01050 extern void
01051 ccn_reset_timeout(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs) {
01052         fs->timeoutSeg = -1;
01053         fs->segsAhead = 0;
01054 }
01055 
01056 /**
01057  * Seeks to a position in a stream.
01058  * Sets the read position.
01059  * It is strongly recommended that the seek is only done to a position that
01060  * is either 0 or has resulted from a successful read.  Otherwise
01061  * end of stream indicators may be returned for a seek beyond the end.
01062  * @returns -1 if the seek is to a bad position, otherwise returns 0.
01063  */
01064 extern int
01065 ccn_fetch_seek(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs, intmax_t pos) {
01066         // seeks to the given position in the input stream
01067         seg_t seg = 0;
01068         intmax_t start = 0;
01069         if (pos == 0) {
01070                 // seek to the start should always be OK
01071                 // (also resets bad segment indicators)
01072                 fs->timeoutSeg = -1;
01073                 fs->zeroLenSeg = -1;
01074                 fs->segsAhead = 0;
01075         } else if (pos == fs->readPosition) {
01076                 // no change
01077                 return 0;
01078         } else {
01079                 // seek elsewhere
01080                 struct ccn_fetch_buffer *fb = FindBufferForPosition(fs, pos);
01081                 if (fb != NULL) {
01082                         // an existing segment, so this is easy
01083                         seg = fb->seg;
01084                         start = fb->pos;
01085                 } else {
01086                         int ss = fs->segSize;
01087                         if (pos < 0 || ss <= 0)
01088                                 // segment size is not known, so indicate that seek fails
01089                                 return -1;
01090                         intmax_t fileSize = fs->fileSize;
01091                         if (fileSize >= 0 && pos > fileSize) {
01092                                 // file size is known exactly, and we have gone too far
01093                                 return -1;
01094                         }
01095                         // at this point we can set the position (failure can occur later on the read)
01096                         seg = pos / ss;
01097                         start = seg * ss;
01098                 }
01099         }
01100         fs->readPosition = pos;
01101         fs->readStart = start;
01102         fs->readSeg = seg;
01103         NeedSegment(fs, seg);
01104         PruneSegments(fs);
01105         
01106         return 0;
01107 }
01108 
01109 /**
01110  * @returns the current read position.
01111  */
01112 extern intmax_t
01113 ccn_fetch_position(struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs) {
01114         return fs->readPosition;
01115 }
